Legal_Issue: Availability of state protection in India
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution in India and sought refugee status in Canada
RPD found contradictions between narrative and documentary evidence
RPD concluded state protection available in India against police abuse
Assessment_Factor: Effectiveness of Indian institutions to provide protection
Credibility_Assessment: RPD found applicant's narrative not credible due to contradictions with documentary evidence
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution in country of origin
Evidence_Assessed: Consistency between oral narrative and documents
Relief_Sought: Overturning of RPD's negative credibility finding
Governing_Rule: Standard of review: reasonableness for state protection; patent unreasonableness for credibility
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Contradictions between applicant's statements and documentary evidence
Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of police abuse in India
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed persecution in India and sought protection in Canada
Evidence_Handling: RPD assessed credibility based on inconsistencies
Evidence_Assessment: Narrative discredited due to lack of consistency with documents
Decision_Rationale: No error in law or fact found in RPD's determination
